alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 5:37PM MST until January 19 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mountain snow and blowing snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Wind gusts up to 50 MPH. Limited visibility is possible with areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Sierra Madre and Snowy Mountain Ranges. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible mountain travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation will be life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can become easily disoriented and lose their way.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
